target_markets.market_description: Larger companies wanting to use AI video for marketing but unsure how to implement without backlash
pain_points: fear of customer pushback against AI
concern about appearing to cut jobs
target_markets.market_size_indicators: Agency scaled to six-seven figures in a few months

problems_validated.problem: Companies want to use AI video but fear negative customer reaction and don't know proper implementation strategy
problems_validated.severity: High - companies are hesitant to adopt despite wanting the technology
problems_validated.current_solutions: Traditional video production, avoiding AI altogether
problems_validated.market_gap: Lack of strategy to implement AI video without customer backlash

products_tools.name: Figma
products_tools.use_case: Creating boards for laying out images in video production workflow

business_strategies.strategy: Start by charging nothing to build spec portfolio, then expand to premium clients
business_strategies.implementation: Target a specific niche, create spec work for companies in that niche, reach out to competitors and look-alikes
business_strategies.expected_results: Build portfolio that leads to higher-paying clients
business_strategies.case_study: Started with pharmaceutical company video, expanded to broader client base

business_strategies.strategy: Scale by working with specialists rather than doing everything yourself
business_strategies.implementation: Work with professional writers, focus on your strengths as director, eventually become executive creative director orchestrating talent
business_strategies.expected_results: Better quality output and ability to scale
business_strategies.case_study: Agency scaled to six-seven figures in few months using this approach

business_strategies.strategy: Comedy-first approach to mitigate AI backlash
business_strategies.implementation: Create Super Bowl commercial style content that's ridiculous and comedy-focused with brand connection at the end
business_strategies.expected_results: Higher engagement, full ad completion, reduced customer pushback
business_strategies.case_study: David Beckham ad got 230 million views, Origin Financial ad got 2 million views

problems_solutions.problem: Creating viral AI videos that don't generate negative customer reaction
problems_solutions.solution: Use comedy-first approach with recognizable IP and make content clearly entertaining rather than trying to replace human work

problems_solutions.problem: Converting script concepts into actual video production
problems_solutions.solution: Systematic workflow from script to final video

startup_ideas.idea: AI-native video production agency specializing in viral content
startup_ideas.target_market: Large companies wanting to use AI video marketing
startup_ideas.problem_solved: Companies want AI video but don't know how to implement without backlash
startup_ideas.business_model: Agency model scaling from free spec work to six-seven figure contracts
startup_ideas.validation: Multiple viral videos with hundreds of millions of views

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Trying to make AI videos that look too realistic or replace human work obviously
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Customer backlash, pitchforks drawn out, negative brand association
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Make content obviously comedic and entertaining, focus on Super Bowl commercial style
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Companies fear customer pushback when AI looks like job replacement

growth_tactics.tactic: Comedy-first AI video content using recognizable IP
growth_tactics.results_expected: Higher completion rates, reduced negative feedback, viral potential

steps: ChatGPT converts script to shot list
Create Figma board for image layout
ai_workflows.use_case: Creating viral AI video advertisements for brands

metrics_kpis.benchmark: 230 million views (David Beckham ad), 2 million views (Origin Financial), 50 million views (Kelshi)
metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Focus on comedy and entertainment value for higher completion rates

trends_signals.trend: Exponential improvement in AI video tools quality
trends_signals.opportunity: 2x improvement in quality every few days creates constantly expanding possibilities for AI video content

trends_signals.trend: Enterprise adoption of AI video with concern about customer backlash
trends_signals.opportunity: Large companies want AI video but need strategy to implement without negative reaction

actionable_quotes.quote: Follow your interest to whatever videos that you like to make. You're naturally going to want to play with it and stick you'll outlast your competition because it feels like work.
actionable_quotes.context: Advice on choosing a niche for AI video production
actionable_quotes.actionability: Choose video niches based on personal interest for long-term sustainability

actionable_quotes.quote: This is going to feel like a Super Bowl commercial in that it's going to be ridiculous. It's going to be comedy first and there's going to be like mostly jokes and a little bit of brand at the end.
actionable_quotes.context: Strategy for creating AI videos that avoid customer backlash
actionable_quotes.actionability: Structure AI video content as comedy-first with minimal brand integration

actionable_quotes.quote: Full open kimono. You guys are going to get full exposure with this.
actionable_quotes.context: Commitment to sharing complete workflow and strategies
actionable_quotes.actionability: Be transparent and share knowledge openly to build trust and authority

key_statistics.statistic: 230 million views on David Beckham AI video ad
key_statistics.context: Example of viral AI video success

key_statistics.statistic: 2 million views on Origin Financial AI video ad
key_statistics.context: Example case study being analyzed in detail

key_statistics.statistic: Six to seven figure agency scale in a few months
key_statistics.context: Growth rate of AI video production agency

key_statistics.statistic: 50 million views on Kelshi viral video

meta.title: My AI Video Hit 300M+ Views (Veo3 + Sora 2 Demo)
